title: Packers continue impressive start to season with victory over Commanders
content: Remember when the Packers couldn't beat any playoff-caliber teams? Not anymore, after their last two wins.

title: Ekeler feared to have torn Achilles, sources say
content: The Commanders fear veteran RB Austin Ekeler tore his right Achilles in the fourth quarter of Thursday night's 27-18 loss to the Packers, sources told ESPN's Adam Schefter. He'll undergo additional testing Friday.

title: WR Reed breaks collarbone in Packers' victory
content: Packers receiver Jayden Reed broke his collarbone on a play that didn't count during the opening drive of Thursday's 27-18 win against the Commanders at Lambeau Field.

title: Collier states MVP case with rare 50-40-90 year
content: Lynx forward Napheesa Collier made her MVP case Thursday night, becoming just the second player in WNBA history to finish a regular season with a 50-40-90 shooting split.

title: Judge belts 2 HRs, ties DiMaggio on Yanks' list
content: Just two days after passing Yogi Berra on the Yankees' all-time home run list, Aaron Judge hit two home runs Thursday to tie Joe DiMaggio for fourth with 361 career home runs.

title: Aces close with record 22 3s in 16th straight win
content: The Aces head into the playoffs with a full head of steam after hitting a WNBA record 22 3-pointers in their 16th consecutive win Thursday night in their regular-season finale.

title: Trout ends career-long drought with 399th homer
content: Mike Trout hit his first homer since Aug. 6, launching the 399th blast of his career Thursday night in a 7-6 loss to the Mariners.

title: Report links Kawhi's late pay to Clippers partner
content: A Clippers limited partner invested $1.99 million in Aspiration nine days before the company made an overdue $1.75 million payment to Kawhi Leonard, according to a report.

content: Authorities in Costa Rica on Thursday raided the hotel in which the 14-year-old son of former Yankees outfielder Brett Gardner was found dead.

title: PM Modi In Manipur Tomorrow In First Visit Since Unrest

title: "Wishing Him A Successful Tenure": PM Modi Congratulates CP Radhakrishnan

title: Japan's Centenarian Population Nears 100,000, 88% Are Women

title: "Karisma's Children Already Got 1,900 Crore": Sunjay Kapur's Wife In Court

title: Prince Harry Makes Surprise Visit To Ukraine In Support Of Wounded Soldiers

title: 'Caste' Among Minorities Shatters Myth Of Muslim Vote Banks In Bihar

title: Meet Diella, World's 1st AI-Made 'Minister' Tasked To Curb Albania Corruption

title: "Because Of 'Me And Mine', You Are Afraid": RSS Chief On US Tariffs

title:
Tracing the history of colonial powers
in Tamil land through charts, maps
content: European sailors prepared maps and diagrams mainly for space and direction. But they have so far remained unused.¬†Recently, 1,862 maps of forts, armouries, granaries, mints, and treasuries ‚Äî selected from the Tamil Nadu State Archives ‚Äî have been uploaded on Tamil Digital Library. They will be the invaluable resources for researchers

title: The hands behind the golu dolls of Bommaikara Theru in Kancheepuram
content: Asthagiri street, known as Bommaikara Theru, in Kancheepuram was once filled with doll makers whose craft defined Navaratri. Today, only a handful of families remain, balancing tradition with changing demand and rising expenses.

title: Wayanad tragedy: Congress leader Jose Nelledam found dead; suspected suicide
content: Congress leader Jose Nelledam, a member of the Mullankolli Grama Panchayat in Wayanad, was discovered dead in a pond near his residence on Friday. Kerala police reports suggest he allegedly cut his wrist after consuming poison before jumping into the water. He was rushed to a hospital but was declared dead.

title: Indian-origin man beheaded: Killer seen kicking severed head- What led to grisly murder
content: In a horrific incident, a Dallas motel manager, Chandra Nagamallaiah, was beheaded by Yordanis Cobos-Martinez after an argument over a broken washing machine. The gruesome attack occurred in front of the victim's family, with the suspect later arrested wearing a blood-soaked T-shirt. ICE officials stated Cobos-Martinez, a Cuban national with a criminal history, should not have been in the U.S.

title: Asia Cup: IPL franchise boycotts India vs Pakistan in unique manner; match on Sept 14
content: As India gears up to face Pakistan in the Asia Cup 2025, the match faces controversy due to terrorism concerns, exemplified by Punjab Kings' social media silence on Pakistan. A Supreme Court plea to cancel the match, citing recent terror attacks and the morale of armed forces, was denied. The clash sparks debate about sports and politics amidst strained relations.

title: 'Warped mentality‚Äô: BJP fumes over AI video of PM Modi, his mother; Cong reacts
content: The BJP has strongly criticized Congress for an AI-generated video that allegedly mocks Prime Minister Narendra Modi and his late mother, Heeraben. BJP leaders accuse Congress of deliberately insulting PM Modi's mother, while Congress defends the video, stating it contains no disrespect. The controversy arises amidst ongoing political tensions, with both parties exchanging accusations and counter-arguments.

title: Tata chip plant‚Äôs wild problem: Snakes, elephants on site; how it‚Äôs managed
content: Tata Electronics is constructing an "Elephant-Proof" wall around its new chip assembly plant in Assam to mitigate ground vibrations caused by elephants, which could disrupt the precision required for semiconductor manufacturing. The project also addresses a snake problem with a dedicated rescue team.

title: Now, Bombay HC receives bomb threat email; hearings suspended, building evacuated
content: Bombay High Court faced a bomb threat via email, leading to immediate evacuation. Hearings were suspended as police and bomb squads searched the complex. Delhi High Court also received a similar threat earlier that day. Authorities are conducting thorough searches at both locations. Recent threats targeted various Mumbai establishments. Officials assured the public that there is no need to panic.

title: 'What is going on?': Gukesh keeps losing, Sarin keeps winning - Indian chess confronts Janus paradox
content: At the FIDE Grand Swiss in Samarkand, Indian chess presents a contrasting picture. Nihal Sarin shines, securing his third consecutive win and joining the lead. Meanwhile, World Champion D Gukesh struggles, losing his third straight game and risking a drop from the top 10. Despite Nihal's success, he humbly credits Viswanathan Anand and Gukesh for India's chess boom.

title: 'You added spice': SC on Kangana's post during farmers' protest
content: The Supreme Court criticized Kangana Ranaut for adding her own commentary to a retweet concerning the 2020-21 farmers' protests, leading her to withdraw her plea seeking to quash a defamation complaint. The court suggested she pursue alternative remedies in the trial court. The case stems from Ranaut's remarks about a woman protester, which the complainant alleges were defamatory.

title: Microsoft CEO admits ‚Äòlack of empathy‚Äô: Tells staff in meeting; ‚ÄòWe will do better‚Äô
content: Microsoft CEO Satya Nadella acknowledged the need to rebuild employee trust following layoffs and a return-to-office mandate. He addressed concerns about a perceived lack of empathy and committed to improvement.

title: Zebra crossing into hearts: Orphaned 'Bombi' thinks zookeeper is her mom- watch
content: An orphaned zebra foal named Bombi, rescued by the Sheldrick Wildlife Trust after her mother was killed by lions, has formed a heartwarming bond with her keeper, Peter. The viral video showcases Bombi affectionately cuddling Peter, who wears a striped coat to mimic a zebra's pattern, aiding in her natural bonding and preventing over-attachment.

title: Bathed after murder: Hyderabad woman tortured for locker code, hit with cooker
content: In a horrifying incident in Hyderabad, two domestic helps allegedly murdered 50-year-old Renu Agarwal, driven by greed to obtain the password to her digital locker. The assailants brutally tortured her, using a pressure cooker, knife, and scissors, before fleeing with stolen gold and cash.

title: Asia Cup | 'Not going to play Pak': IPL chairman makes position clear
content: Arun Dhumal, IPL chairman, affirmed India's commitment to playing Pakistan only in ACC/ICC events, adhering to government policy amidst Asia Cup boycott call. This decision follows heightened tensions after a terrorist attack in Pahalgam, leading to military action. Couple of months ago, Dhumal also managed a crisis during the IPL when PBKS' match in Dharamsala was halted before the league was paused.

title: Red Sea cable cut: Internet hit Middle East; 3 reasons repairs may take months
content: Internet services in India, Pakistan, and the Middle East are facing disruptions due to severed undersea cables in the Red Sea. Experts attribute the damage to a commercial ship dragging its anchor. Repairing the cables could take weeks due to the limited number of specialized companies and the complex undersea operations required.

title: CBSE's LOC dates out: Class 10, 12 allowed partial APAAR ID relief; details here
content: CBSE has released the 2025 schedule for Class 10 and 12 LOC submissions, private candidate forms, and CWSN exam exemptions. Schools get partial APAAR ID relief, allowing entries as ‚ÄúREFUSED‚Äù or ‚ÄúNOGEN‚Äù where applicable. Key deadlines range from August 29 to October 11, 2025. Students and schools must follow CBSE‚Äôs updated guidelines for error-free submissions.

title: 'Good he is going': Rahul welcomes PM Modi's Manipur visit; raises 'vote chori' issue
content: Rahul Gandhi acknowledged Prime Minister Modi's upcoming Manipur visit, highlighting the ongoing ethnic clashes. However, he shifted focus to allegations of "vote theft" in Haryana and Maharashtra, claiming widespread public distrust. Modi's visit to Manipur, his first since the violence, aims to address the crisis with development projects and meetings with displaced families from both Kuki and Meitei communities.

title: After Aishwarya Rai, Delhi HC protects Abhishek Bachchan's personality rights
content: Abhishek Bachchan secures a win in Delhi High Court. The court safeguards his personality rights. Online platforms are now restricted from using his name and images illegally. This prevents unauthorized commercial exploitation. The court order addresses misuse, including AI-generated content. It protects Bachchan's reputation and dignity. The decision acknowledges the importance of personality rights.

title: Gujarat floods: Waterlogging woes spark violent clashes in villages; 15 injured
content: Rural Gujarat is witnessing a surge in violent clashes due to monsoon-induced waterlogging. Disputes over blocked drains and stagnant rainwater in villages like Mandal and Vithlapur have resulted in injuries and heightened tensions. Experts attribute this to heavy rains, illegal constructions obstructing natural drainage, and failed governance, threatening community harmony and rural livelihoods.

title: ‚ÄòToo large to lose‚Äô: Russia oil competitively priced for India; strong interest despite sanctions
content: Despite Western pressure and potential sanctions, India and China's demand for Russian crude oil remains strong, according to Vortexa. Russian crude maintains a significant, price-competitive presence in these markets.

title: Delhi HC evacuated after bomb threat; email warns of blast after mid-day Friday prayers
content: The Delhi High Court faced a security scare on Friday following an email threat of a bomb blast in a judge's chamber after Islamic prayers. Authorities promptly evacuated the premises and deployed bomb detection squads. The email, purportedly from 'Kanimozhi Thevidiya,' mentioned a conspiracy involving individuals, ISI, and a plan to recreate the 1998 blasts.

title: 'Sabnike pranaam': MEA's Randhir Jaiswal greets Mauritius PM in Bhojpuri - watch video
content: External Affairs Ministry spokesperson Randhir Jaiswal welcomed Mauritius Prime Minister Navinchandra Ramgoolam in Varanasi, speaking in Bhojpuri to highlight the deep cultural ties. Prime Minister Modi emphasized the spiritual connection between the two nations, rooted in shared traditions. The leaders discussed enhanced cooperation in various sectors, reinforcing the strategic partnership and India's commitment to its 'Neighbourhood First' policy.

title: Umar Khalid calls FIR in Delhi riots case a 'joke'
content: Umar Khalid's legal team has dismissed the UAPA case FIR concerning the 2020 Delhi riots as a "joke" during court proceedings. Advocate Trideep Pais argued the FIR lacks legal sanctity, questioning its connection to the alleged conspiracy. He cited court observations from other riots cases, alleging investigative bias and fabricated evidence against Khalid.

title: Prince Harry's 'surprise visit' to Kyiv: Duke pledges support for wounded soldiers
content: Prince Harry made a surprise visit to Kyiv, responding to an invitation from the Ukrainian government to support the rehabilitation of wounded military personnel. Accompanied by the Invictus Games Foundation, he aims to launch initiatives aiding recovery, emphasizing the importance of humanizing those affected by the conflict. Ukraine has integrated sports into its veteran policy, with over 22,000 veterans accessing related benefits.

title: Noida dowry death case: Court rejects bail pleas of Nikki‚Äôs husband & in-laws
content: A court in Noida has denied bail to the husband and in-laws of Nikki Bhati, who died from severe burns following allegations of dowry harassment. The family is accused of setting Nikki on fire, but the defense claims a cylinder blast caused the incident, presenting CCTV footage as evidence.

title: Solar Eclipse 2025: List of nations to witness 'Surya Grahan'; timings & safety tips
content: The solar eclipse on September 21, 2025, a partial eclipse, will be visible in the Southern Hemisphere, including Australia, New Zealand, and Antarctica. India will miss direct visibility, but can view it via live streams. At its peak, nearly 85% of the Sun will be covered, offering a dramatic view for those within the path of visibility.

title: India pushes back against Trump pressure: Russia crude imports rise
content: In August, India's Russian crude oil imports neared China's, reaching ‚Ç¨2.9 billion. The US has pressured India to reduce these purchases, even imposing tariffs on Indian exports. Despite this, India defends its position, highlighting that China, the EU, and others continue to import substantial amounts of Russian energy.

title: Charlie Kirk shooting: Patrick Mahomes quiet; Randi Mahomes, Tavia Hunt speaks out
content: Following the tragic shooting death of Charlie Kirk at Utah Valley University, Patrick Mahomes has remained silent. Tavia Hunt, wife of the Chiefs owner, expressed grief and called for civility, a sentiment echoed by Patrick's mother, Randi Mahomes, who shared Tavia's post. The investigation into Kirk's death is ongoing, sparking renewed debate about violence.

title: Dallas horror: Who is Yordanis Cobos-Martinez? Suspect behind Indian man's beheading
content: In a horrific incident at a Dallas motel, Yordanis Cobos-Martinez allegedly beheaded his co-worker, Chandra Nagamallaiah, following an argument. Cobos-Martinez, a migrant worker with a prior criminal record, was apprehended at the scene while carrying the machete. ICE confirmed he had been previously released under supervision due to lack of deportation flights.

title: 2 Nepal jail fugitives enter India, cops simply hand them over to their families in UP
content: Two Indian men, Chitranjan Sarkar and Ranjan Vishwas, who escaped from a Nepal prison, were briefly detained by Indian border security before being released to their families. Despite an extradition treaty between India and Nepal, authorities cited the absence of crimes committed on Indian soil as the reason for their release.

title: 'This is not him': Gukesh loses third game in a row at Grand Swiss; Sarin in joint-lead
content: D Gukesh faced another setback at the FIDE Grand Swiss, losing to Ediz Gurel, while Nihal Sarin joined Matthias Bluebaum in the lead. Several Indian players, including Praggnanandhaa, secured victories, improving their standings. Vaishali Rameshbabu took the sole lead in the women's section, increasing her chances to qualify for the Candidates tournament.

title: Tiana Mangakahia dies at 30: Remembering her career, family and cancer battle
content: Tiana Mangakahia, the former Syracuse University basketball star and WNBL guard, has tragically passed away at 30 after battling breast cancer. Her remarkable journey included leading Syracuse, fighting cancer, and playing professionally in the WNBA and Australia. Mangakahia's resilience and passion inspired many, leaving a lasting legacy of courage and determination on and off the court.

title: 'He was a good man': Trump slams Jair Bolsonaro verdict
content: Donald Trump has strongly criticized Brazil's Supreme Court for sentencing Jair Bolsonaro to over 27 years in prison for allegedly attempting to overturn the 2022 election. Trump, calling the ruling ‚Äúvery surprising,‚Äù hinted at possible sanctions against Brazil, a move condemned by Secretary of State Marco Rubio.

title: Charlie Kirk shooting: FBI drops new pics, videos of suspect - 10 things to know
content: Charlie Kirk, prominent conservative figure and Turning Point USA co-founder, was fatally shot while discussing gun violence at Utah Valley University. The FBI is seeking a suspect, offering a $100,000 reward, and has released images of a person of interest. Political figures across the spectrum have condemned the attack, with tributes pouring in for Kirk.

title: India gets new VP! CP Radhakrishnan takes oath as 15th vice-president; Dhankhar present
content: CP Radhakrishnan was sworn in as the 15th Vice-President of India at Rashtrapati Bhavan, with President Drapadi Murmu administering the oath. The ceremony was attended by prominent leaders, including Prime Minister Modi and former Vice-Presidents. Radhakrishnan, the NDA candidate, won the election with 452 votes against B Sudershan Reddy. The date was selected based on auspicious timing.

title: Nepal Gen Z protests: 12k+ prisoners at large; uncertainty over interim PM continues ‚Äì Key points
content: Nepal witnessed Gen Z protests that led to government collapse. Thirty-four people died and over a thousand were injured. The protests started due to social media ban. Sushila Karki is likely to become caretaker prime minister. Balen Shah supports Karki. Over twelve thousand prisoners escaped during the unrest. Curfew timings have been relaxed. Protesters demand end to corruption and favouritism.

title: Dallas: Indian-origin man beheaded at motel in front of wife & son; suspect arrested
content: In a shocking incident at a Dallas motel, 50-year-old Chandramouli Nagamallaiah, an Indian-origin man, was brutally beheaded in front of his family. The suspect, Yordanis Cobos-Martinez, a motel employee, has been arrested and charged with capital murder. The gruesome attack reportedly stemmed from a dispute over a broken washing machine.

title: Jayden Reed injury: Packers star suffers broken collarbone in opening season
content: The Green Bay Packers defeated the Washington Commanders 27-18, but the victory was overshadowed by a significant injury. Wide receiver Jayden Reed suffered a broken collarbone on the opening drive, casting doubt on his season availability. Despite Reed's absence, the Packers managed to secure the win, highlighting both their resilience and the impact of the injury on their offense.

title: Filmmaker S Narayan & family booked after daughter-in-law files dowry harassment case
content: Sandalwood director S Narayan, his wife Bhagyavati, and son Pavan face legal trouble after Pavan's wife, Pavitra, filed a dowry harassment case. Pavitra alleges she was forced to provide dowry, support her jobless husband, and financially assist the family's film academy. Police have issued notices to Narayan and his family, directing them to appear for investigation regarding the allegations.

title: Trump for Nobel Prize? Peace panel says decision based on merit
content: Despite Donald Trump's repeated claims and endorsements from foreign leaders, the Norwegian Nobel Committee asserts its independence in selecting the Peace Prize laureate. The committee emphasizes that media attention and public campaigns do not influence their evaluation process, focusing solely on nominees' merits and contributions to peace. Experts suggest Trump's chances are low, citing his policies contrasting with Nobel's principles of multilateralism.

title: Price prediction: Gold may find support at Rs 1,09,000. What's the outlook for today?
content: Gold price prediction today: Jateen Trivedi of LKP Securities suggests a 'buy on dips' strategy for gold investors, citing bullish trends. Gold futures are resilient near ‚Çπ1,08,979, awaiting US economic data. Technical indicators support buying near ‚Çπ1,09,000 with a stop-loss at ‚Çπ1,08,600, targeting ‚Çπ1,10,000, as EMAs hold firm and MACD confirms bullish signals.

title: 'Asked us to get rid of Israel': Cycling team to change name; protests expected in Canada
content: Cycling team Israel-Premier Tech will race under the name IPT in Canada this week to avoid potential pro-Palestinian protests. Organizers confirmed the team requested the removal of "Israel" from their branding for the Quebec and Montreal races. This decision follows similar demonstrations that disrupted the Vuelta a Espana, prompted by the ongoing conflict in Gaza.

title: China rare earth curbs: Indian automakers strained as magnet exports yet to resume
content: Despite China easing rare earth export restrictions, Indian automakers still face critical magnet supply shortages, impacting production. Ashok Leyland and TVS Motor Co. are managing the shortfall daily, while others like Maruti Suzuki and Mahindra & Mahindra remain unaffected for now. The situation highlights India's reliance on Chinese supplies, prompting efforts to diversify through international agreements and overseas asset acquisition.

title: Charlie Kirk assassination: New FBI video shows suspect leaping off building to escape
content: The FBI and Utah authorities released a video of the suspect in Charlie Kirk's fatal shooting, showing him fleeing across a Utah Valley University building. Utah Governor Spencer Cox reported over 7,000 tips received, highlighting law enforcement's dedication. Officials are preparing to pursue the death penalty, while a video surfaced showing a man resembling the suspect limping nearby.

title: Kathmandu hotel set on fire, Ghaziabad woman falls to death
content: An arson attack on a Kathmandu hotel, following protests against the Nepal government, resulted in the death of a 55-year-old woman from Ghaziabad. Rajesh Devi Singh Gola fell while attempting to escape the burning hotel using makeshift ropes. Her husband, Ramveer Singh Gola, was injured during the escape. The Indian Embassy and local administration are assisting the family.

title: Delhi court grants bail to actor Ashish Kapoor in alleged rape case
content: Delhi's Tis Hazari Court granted bail to TV actor Ashish Kapoor, arrested in connection with an alleged rape case in Pune. The court considered CCTV footage, Kapoor's cooperation, and his permanent residency in Delhi while granting bail. Advocates argued the complainant was intoxicated and had a history of filing complaints, while co-accused individuals had already received bail.

title: Fantasy hockey goalie guide: Best picks, draft strategy
content: a goalie who stops 28 of 30 shots in a 4-2 win produces 5.6 prized points . a loss of -4.8 points nets a potentially painful swing, indeed . falling short between the pipes can make for a very long fantasy season .

title: Experts' picks and best bet: How can Crawford upset Canelo?
content: if he beats Canelo, he will become the first fighter in men's boxing to unify all four major belts in three divisions . he defeated Caleb Plant by 11th-round TKO in November 2021 to become undisputed champion at 168 pounds . the IBF stripped him for not fighting mandatory challenger William Scull .

title: How the NYPD and FDNY honor 9/11 with football, 20 years on
content: cops and firemen heckled each other nonstop from the opening kiwi . they were playing in observance of the 20th anniversary of 9/11 . the two football teams had lost too many people on that day . but they did not put aside their rivalry .

title: Survivor pool strategy: The top teams to take in Week 2
content: ESPN Eliminator Challenge is one of the most fun and simple games to play this season . the rules are simple: pick one team, and as long as they win (or tie), you advance to the next round . if they lose, you are out .
